![](https://www.caldwelltx.gov/api/blob/viewBlob?i=8UBlMdkW%2FPnyWbqxJAgefuBaazqGhN%2FRSar9R7GmITUxsTdHvDbhSYhW9XVKCs3u&s=xlarge)

The City of Caldwell is dedicated to ensuring the safest possible road and drainage infrastructure for community members and those passing through by ensuring that these systems are kept well maintained and up to the highest possible standards. The Public Works department is responsible for maintaining all City-owned streets and alleys, drainage ditches and storm sewer inlets, and street signage and lighting.
[![](../ic?i=gear&c2=transparent&c1=%2310345c&c3=%23ededed)
Capital Improvement Projects](https://www.caldwelltx.gov/capitalimprovement)
[![](../ic?i=money&c2=transparent&c1=%2310345c&c3=%23ededed)
Grants & Funding](https://www.caldwelltx.gov/grants)

Caldwell Transportation Map
Know before you go! The
[*City of Caldwell Transportation Map*](javascript:;)
is a GIS map application that provides specific, detailed information about current and upcoming road closures in the City. The map is a great tool to learn about local transportation conditions so you can avoid traffic congestion and reach your destination safer and sooner.
The
[*City of Caldwell Transportation Map*](javascript:;)
is not a navigational tool for real-time navigation purposes and may not include every incident/emergency that occurs on city streets.
If you have questions or feedback regarding the City of Caldwell Transportation Map, please email
[*development@caldwelltx.gov*](javascript:;)
.
What is included on the Transportation Map?
The map application contains the following layers:

1. : a layer updated by City of Caldwell Staff containing information on road closures initiated by the City and detour information. Closures from other entities are not included on this layer.
2. : This layer contains Average Annual Daily Traffic (AADT) data from TxDOT counters on highways in the City of Caldwell. Data shown reflects the most recent data available.
3. : a data layer from Esri that utilizes GPS data and algorithms to show traffic conditions on City streets. See here for further information on this layer.
4. : Locations of railroads in the City of Caldwell.
5. : Locations of existing sidewalks in the City of Caldwell.

How to Use the Transportation Map
[*Click here*](javascript:;)
to access the City of Caldwell Transportation Map. Below are some of the main functions and features available in the map application.

* Use the search bar to locate a specific address on the map.
  + [![](https://www.caldwelltx.gov/wp-content/uploads/2023/04/Search-Bar.png)](https://www.caldwelltx.gov/search-bar/)
* Click the “Legend” button to toggle the legend on or off, which provides a description of the map symbols and automatically updates based on the layers that are currently displayed.
  + [![](https://www.caldwelltx.gov/wp-content/uploads/2023/04/Legend.png)](https://www.caldwelltx.gov/legend/)
* Click the “Basemap Gallery” button to view available basemaps, including satellite imagery.
  + [![](https://www.caldwelltx.gov/wp-content/uploads/2023/04/Basemap-Gallery.png)](https://www.caldwelltx.gov/basemap-gallery/)
* Click the “Measurement” button to open a box that allows measurement of area by drawing a polygon, measurement of distance by drawing a line, or identification of the GPS coordinates of a specific point. Click the function desired in the box and then begin clicking on the map to draw the polygon, line, or point.
  + [![](https://www.caldwelltx.gov/wp-content/uploads/2023/04/Measurement.png)](https://www.caldwelltx.gov/measurement/)
* Click the “My Location” button to zoom the map to your current location. Location services must be allowed on your browser/computer for this button to work.
  + [![](https://www.caldwelltx.gov/wp-content/uploads/2023/04/My-Location.png)](https://www.caldwelltx.gov/my-location/)
* Click the “Home” button to return to the map’s default view.
  + [![](https://www.caldwelltx.gov/wp-content/uploads/2023/04/Home.png)](https://www.caldwelltx.gov/home-3/)
* Click the “Plus” or “Minus” buttons to zoom in or out. Zooming may also be done by scrolling a mouse wheel or using two fingers to zoom on a trackpad.
  + [![](https://www.caldwelltx.gov/wp-content/uploads/2023/04/Zoom.png)](https://www.caldwelltx.gov/zoom/)
* The bottom left corner contains informational displays of the map scale and the coordinates of the current location of the cursor.
  + [![](https://www.caldwelltx.gov/wp-content/uploads/2023/04/Map-Scale.png)](https://www.caldwelltx.gov/map-scale/)

If you have questions or feedback regarding the City of Caldwell Transportation Map, please email
[development@caldwelltx.gov](javascript:;)
.
![](https://www.caldwelltx.gov/api/blob/viewBlob?i=hWUNRq3Y4J4EPOkcqFI75QNUe%2Fju%2FGCW9Mgc5Ow8TXTQQltOcw5fYTkcOKMZrgBf&s=large)

Remove your Passkey

Imagine signing into your account as easily as unlocking your phone—no more worrying about remembering or typing a password. A passkey is a secure digital key that uses the safety features in your device to keep your account protected. It’s designed to be both simple to use and highly secure.
Ready to experience a simpler, safer sign-in? Click the button above to create your passkey now.
